conclusion: Electromagnetic aircraft launch is advanced technology; China is advanced in this field.
An interest group is researching electromagnetic launch system design.
Figure (1) shows a coil in a radial magnetic field with a constant current source and a switch.
The mover is insulated, fixed to the coil, and slides without friction on horizontal rails.
When switch S is connected to 1, the constant current source is connected to the coil.
The mover starts from rest, accelerating the aircraft until it detaches at takeoff speed.
Switch S is thrown to 2, connecting the fixed resistor R0, and a retraction force F is applied.
Under F and magnetic force, the mover returns to its initial position and stops.
The v-t diagram shows mover's motion from rest to return.
From t1 to t3, F=(800-10v)N, and F is removed at t3.
Air resistance and aircraft takeoff effect on mover's velocity are negligible.
The mover starts from rest and accelerates to takeoff speed v1=80m/s from t1=1.5s to t2.
Acceleration phase is from t1 to t2 with retraction force F applied.
Using v=u+at with u=0, solve for t2: t2=v1/a.
Substitute known values: a=F/m=(800-10v)/5=(800-10*80)/5=40m/s².
Calculate t2=80/40=2s.
Current I can be found from equation of motion: v²=2aS.
Substitute v1=80m/s and S=l*n*v1=1*100*80=8000m².
During return phase, mover decelerates and returns to initial position.
